item.description:
So far all the Yale School of Music and Drama events I've been to have been terrific! Looking forward to this one, hoping to see a lot of you there!
Meet at the hall at 7:00, take seats no later than 7:15. The place always draws a huge crowd and is standing room only by showtime, so get there as early as possible!
We'll head out after the show for food/refreshment depending on interest.
-Neil, 645-2008

Yale Concert Band
Thomas C. Duffy, Music Director
7:30 PM, Friday, April 4, 2008
Woolsey Hall : Free Admission
with special guests the Bloomfield (Conn.) High School Band
and members of the Yale Alumni Chorus
featuring two world premieres:

Sicut Incipiat ("Thus Let it Begin"), written by Yale Band and
School of Music alumnus Robert Parker.
Written for Yale's Commencement, this is the first piece generated by the
newly-established Robert J. Flanagan Yale Bands Commissioning Fund

An Identity by student composer Raymond Clark of Bloomfield High School

and:

Berceuse & Finale from "The Firebird" by Igor Stravinsky,
Suite Francaise by Darius Milhaud
Cartoon by Paul Hart
item.name: Yale Concert Band
